title: The Stable Shift Algorithm
text: autospc package implements Stable Shift Algorithm re-establishing control limits statistical process control (SPC) analysis. vignette describes problem algorithm addresses, sets useful terminology, describes algorithm, explains use algorithm log.

title: The Stable Shift Algorithm
text: standard approach SPC analysis quality improvement goes follows: gather extract data period time prior planned improvement initiative plot data control chart, forming baseline control limits Extend baseline limits future Add data chart time progresses, without updating control limits example shown Figure 2.1. uses ed_attendances_monthly dataset included autospc. information dataset see ?ed_attendances_monthly. Figure 2.1: Extending baseline control limits data added, process may shift higher lower level. Indeed, often aim improvement initiative. prompts question whether control limits re-established better represent new process. Whilst various textbooks online resources offer opinions issue, universally accepted approach. Stable Shift Algorithm (SSA) offers automated, consistent rigorous approach re-establishing control limits.
code: facet_stages(   ed_attendances_monthly %>%     filter(row_number() <= 32L),   split_rows = c("Baseline" = 24L,                  "Data added beyond baseline" = 28L,                  "Further data added" = 32L),   x = Month_Start,    y = Att_All,   chartType = "C'",   periodMin = 24,   use_caption = FALSE,   x_break = 91.25,   x_date_format = "%Y-%b",   extend_limits_to = as.Date("2018-04-01"),   upper_annotation_sf = 0.825 ) #> Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'ggpp': #>   method                  from    #>   heightDetails.titleGrob ggplot2 #>   widthDetails.titleGrob  ggplot2

title: The Stable Shift Algorithm
text: main idea SSA re-establish limits : . evidence process shifted new level B. shift persists long enough compute new control limits words, SSA re-establishes limits shift rule breaks, provided shift “transient” sense. “transient” means calculate new control limits, shift rule break back towards original process. next two sections make idea precise describe operationalised SSA.

title: The Stable Shift Algorithm
text: First, useful introduce terminology. refer Figure 3.1 illustrate concepts introduced section. figure shows C-chart first 35 data points simulated example_series_2a data included autospc, purpose section shall interpret daily values count measure interest. Figure 3.1: Example 1
code: plot_auto_SPC(example_series_2a %>%                 filter(row_number() <= 35L),               override_y_title = "Count",               chartType = "C",               extend_limits_to = 47L)

Runs subsets longer runs end point count , example default runRuleLength = 8, run length 10 3.1 actually comprises three rule-breaking runs, commencing first, second third points length 10 run. example, first rule-breaking run starts day 22 length 10, second starts day 23 length 9, third starts day 24 length 8. run commences day 25, fourth point length 10 run, rule-breaking, since length 7 .

text: order decide whether re-establish control limits triggering rule break, SSA requires consideration set limits established. referred candidate limits either rejected accepted. Candidate limits formed first periodMin points starting first point triggering rule break, period referred candidate calculation period. Figure 3.1, fewer periodMin (21) points start triggering rule break (day 22), possible re-establish limits day 22, candidate limits consider. Figure 3.2 imagine rolling time forward, data add chart 3.1. Figure 3.2 shows data (baseline) calculation limits. Figure 3.3 shows candidate limits established start triggering rule break, .e. day 22. Figure 3.2: Example 2 Figure 3.3: Example 3
code: plot_auto_SPC(example_series_2a,               override_y_title = "Count",               chartType = "C",               noRecals = TRUE,               extend_limits_to = 47L) plot_auto_SPC(example_series_2a,               override_y_title = "Count",               chartType = "C",               extend_limits_to = 47L)

title: The Stable Shift Algorithm
text: rule break within candidate calculation period, rule break opposite direction triggering rule break, referred opposing rule break. also sometimes refer rule break reversion, reverting original limits. Figure 3.3 opposing rule break within candidate calculation period. Figure 3.4 shows alternative continuation baseline time series considered far. series identical first day 26, differs thereafter. still triggering rule break baseline limits commencing day 22. Figure 3.5 shows candidate limits established start triggering rule break, .e. day 22. opposing rule break Figure 3.5, commencing day 31. Figure 3.4: Example 4 Figure 3.5: Example 5 opposing rule break reaches runRuleLength threshold end candidate calculation period, referred overhanging reversion. Figure 3.6 shows another alternative continuation example time series, time showing overhanging reversion commencing day 40, candidate limits. Figure 3.6: Example 6
code: plot_auto_SPC(example_series_2b,               override_y_title = "Count",               chartType = "C",               noRecals = TRUE,               extend_limits_to = 47L) plot_auto_SPC(example_series_2b,               override_y_title = "Count",               chartType = "C",               recalEveryShift = TRUE,               extend_limits_to = 47L) plot_auto_SPC(example_series_2c,               override_y_title = "Count",               chartType = "C",               recalEveryShift = TRUE)

previous_headings: 3 The Stable Shift Algorithm > 3.2 Some terminology
title: The Stable Shift Algorithm
text: SSA requires specification minimum number data points used calculation control limits, \(n_{min}\). Whilst using SPC practice may often make minimum explicit, way always implicitly - nobody compute control limits two data points ? fact, various authors offer guidance minimum , values ranging 17 25 points. plot_auto_SPC(), \(n_{min}\) specified periodMin argument, defaulting 21. default commonly recommended minimum values represents convenient choice daily data, since multiple 7. means presence weekly “seasonal” (periodic) variation 7 day period limits unduly affected day week limit calculation period begins . using monthly data, preferable use \(n_{min} = 24\), reason.

title: The Stable Shift Algorithm
text: steps algorithm follows: Algorithm counter initialised first data point. Check sufficient data form least one set limits. time series fewer points \(n_{min}\), according SSA control limits can established. time series length \(n\) \(n_{min}\leq n < 2n_{min}\), sufficient data points form one period. SSA establishes limits calculated first \(n_{min}\) points, limits extended remainder data. However, case sufficient data points re-establish second set limits, SSA terminates establishing first set limits. , therefore, assume number data points time series analysed \(n \geq 2n_{min}\). first set limits established, counter set first point end first calculation period. Main algorithm loop begins fewer \(n_{min}\) data points remaining counter, insufficient data points re-establish limits, algorithm terminates. rule-breaking runs, algorithm terminates. least one rule-breaking run, algorithm sets counter first data point first run, now labelled triggering run. check sufficient data remaining counter. , terminate. , candidate limits formed first \(n_{min}\) data points beginning counter. Decide whether accept reject candidate limits: least one opposing rule break commencing within candidate calculation period, candidate limits rejected, counter set next rule-breaking run (triggering rule break) prevailing limits, algorithm continues (3). final run candidate calculation period become opposing rule break addition data time series, candidate limits rejected, counter set next rule-breaking run (triggering rule break) prevailing limits, algorithm continues (3). neither conditions () (ii) met, candidate limits accepted, established start triggering rule break, extended rest data. counter set first point end new calculation period, algorithm continues (3). algorithm visualised flow chart .
code: grViz(autospc:::algorithm_flow_chart_string)

title: The Stable Shift Algorithm
text: like view log path flow diagram given timeseries, two ways can .

title: The Stable Shift Algorithm
text: print log console, set verbosity argument plot_auto_SPC() either 1 (basic log information) 2 (full detail).
code: plot_auto_SPC(   ed_attendances_monthly,    chartType = "C'",    x = Month_Start,    y = Att_All,   verbosity = 1,   x_break = 365,   x_date_format = "%Y-%b",   point_size = 1L ) #>  #> C': #>  #> Counter at 1, 2015-05-31: #> - Counter initialised to 1. #> - Sufficient data to form at least one period. #>  #> Counter at 22, 2017-03-01: #> - Main algorithm loop commenced. #> - Sufficient data to proceed. Moving counter to the next shift #> rule break, commencing at point 23. #>  #> Counter at 23, 2017-03-31: #> - There is a shift rule break commencing here, upwards from #> the current centre line. #> - Forming candidate limits. #> - Candidate limits accepted, limits re-established. #>  #> Counter at 44, 2019-01-01: #> - Sufficient data to proceed. Moving counter to the next shift #> rule break, commencing at point 46. #>  #> Counter at 46, 2019-03-01: #> - There is a shift rule break commencing here, upwards from #> the current centre line. #> - Forming candidate limits. #> - Candidate limits accepted, limits re-established. #>  #> Counter at 67, 2020-12-01: #> - Sufficient data to proceed. Moving counter to the next shift #> rule break, commencing at point 71. #>  #> Counter at 71, 2021-03-31: #> - There is a shift rule break commencing here, upwards from #> the current centre line. #> - Forming candidate limits. #> - Candidate limits accepted, limits re-established. #>  #> Counter at 92, 2023-01-01: #> - Insufficient remaining data for further re-establishment of #> limits.

title: The Stable Shift Algorithm
text: save log file, provide file path using log_file_path argument plot_auto_SPC(). file path provide ends ".rds" log saved rds file, ends ".csv" log saved csv file. data frame saved one row log entry, contains following columns: counter : counter value (row number dataframe passed df argument plot_auto_SPC()) log entry refers x : value x column counter value (column passed x plot_auto_SPC()) log_entry : log entry, recorded shorthand (see ) interpretation : text interpretation log entry Note full log details saved, regardless value verbosity argument.

title: The Stable Shift Algorithm
text: log populated algorithm executes, using shorthand notation described following table. shorthand forms content log_entry column log dataframe exported log_file_path.
code: log_exp_tab <- autospc:::log_explanation_table log_exp_tab %>%    knitr::kable()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Thomas Woodcock. Author, maintainer. Imogen O'Connor. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Woodcock T, O'Connor (2025). autospc: Automatically Partitioned SPC Charts. R package version 0.0.0.9039, https://horridtom.github.io/autospc/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {autospc: Automatically Partitioned SPC Charts},   author = {Thomas Woodcock and Imogen O'Connor},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9039},   url = {https://horridtom.github.io/autospc/}, }

title: Automatically Partitioned SPC Charts
text: autospc provides rigorous consistent means re-establishing limits Shewhart charts (also known control charts), using Stable Shift Algorithm. main function plot_auto_SPC(), plots Shewhart charts various types appropriate different types data, limits established using algorithm.

title: Automatically Partitioned SPC Charts
text: autospc can installed using devtools package. Install devtools already done install.packages("devtools") can install autospc devtools::install_github("HorridTom/autospc") may give option install packages autospc dependent . installed, can load autospc usual library(autospc)

title: Automatically Partitioned SPC Charts
text: example dataset ed_attendances_monthly, provided autospc, typical time series data Stable Shift Algorithm designed . example code uses dataset, can executed autospc loaded. C, C’ XmR chart data must following columns: x-axis variable: date, POSIXct, numeric integer type. name column can specified x argument plot_auto_SPC(). y-axis variable : numeric integer type. name column can specified y argument plot_auto_SPC() function. example: P P’ chart data must following columns: x-axis variable: date, POSIXct, numeric integer type. name column can specified x argument plot_auto_SPC(). denominator total count (e.g. number ED attendances): numeric integer type. name column can specified n argument plot_auto_SPC(). numerator (e.g. number ED attendances less 4 hours duration): numeric integer type. name column can specified y argument plot_auto_SPC(). example: parameters Stable Shift Algorithm, appearance chart, can configured various arguments. Use ?autospc::plot_auto_SPC find .
code: plot_auto_SPC(ed_attendances_monthly,                 chartType = "C'",                 x = Month_Start,                 y = Att_All) plot_auto_SPC(ed_attendances_monthly,                 chartType = "P'",                 x = Month_Start,                 y = Within_4h,                 n = Att_All)

title: Automatically Partitioned SPC Charts
text: addition default plot output, analysis results can obtained table format using plotChart = FALSE, follows:
code: limits_table <- plot_auto_SPC(ed_attendances_monthly,                               chartType = "P'",                               x = Month_Start,                               y = Within_4h,                               n = Att_All,                               plotChart = FALSE)  head(limits_table,       n = 5L)

title: Automatically Partitioned SPC Charts

title: Automatically recalculate SPC control limits — create_SPC_auto_limits_table
code: create_SPC_auto_limits_table(   data,   chartType,   periodMin,   baseline,   runRuleLength,   maxNoOfExclusions,   noRegrets,   verbosity,   noRecals,   recalEveryShift,   rule2Tolerance,   showLimits,   overhangingReversions,   mr_screen_max_loops )

title: Automatically recalculate SPC control limits — create_SPC_auto_limits_table
text: data data frame. XMR, C C' chart, must columns: x, subgrouping variable, plotted horizontal axis; y, variable interest plotted vertical axis; P P' chart, must columns: x, subgrouping variable, plotted horizontal axis; n, total count denominator; y, count meeting criteria, numerator; chartType type chart wish plot. Available options : "XMR", "MR", "C", "C'", "P", "P'". periodMin minimum number points (subgroups) per period, .e. minimum number points required form control limits. baseline Integer, overrides periodMin first calculation period , specified runRuleLength minimum number consecutive points centre line constituting shift ("rule 2") break. maxNoOfExclusions maximum number extreme points exclude limit calculations. noRegrets Boolean signifying version algorithm used. Defines whether limits can change data added . verbosity Integer 0-2 specifying talkative algorithm standard output log; higher number information provided, none 0. noRecals Boolean - TRUE, recalculate control limits, instead extend limits calculated first periodMin points. recalEveryShift Boolean - whether bypass Stable Shift Algorithm simply re-establish limits every shift rule break (respecting periodMin) rule2Tolerance Minimum difference point's vertical position centre line count "centre line" purposes shift rule breaks showLimits Boolean controlling whether display centre line control limits overhangingReversions Boolean determining whether rule breaks opposite direction rule break triggering candidate recalculation prevent recalculation even overhang end candidate calculation period. Set FALSE noRegrets = FALSE. mr_screen_max_loops Integer Inf specifying maximum number times recursively ignore mr values upper range limit calculating xmr limits. Note affect calculation upper range limit mr chart.

title: Automatically recalculate SPC control limits — create_SPC_auto_limits_table
text: Parameters control behaviour algorithm used re-establish control limits.

title: Automatically recalculate SPC control limits — create_SPC_auto_limits_table
text: Parameters control cetnre line control limits established period, details SPC rules applied

title: Automatically recalculate SPC control limits — create_SPC_auto_limits_table
text: data frame limits, rule breaks additional info needed plotting

title: Automatically recalculate SPC control limits — create_SPC_auto_limits_table
code: # Calculate limts for a C' chart for count of monthly attendances  df <- ed_attendances_monthly %>%         dplyr::rename(x = Month_Start,                       y = Att_All)  limits_table <- create_SPC_auto_limits_table(   df,   chartType = "C'",   periodMin = 21,   baseline = NULL,   runRuleLength = 8,   maxNoOfExclusions = 3,   noRegrets = TRUE,   verbosity = 1L,   noRecals = FALSE,   recalEveryShift = FALSE,   rule2Tolerance = 0,   showLimits = TRUE,   overhangingReversions = TRUE,   mr_screen_max_loops = 1L )  head(limits_table) #> # A tibble: 6 × 14 #>   x              y    ucl   lcl    cl periodType excluded breakPoint rule1 rule2 #>   <date>     <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>      <lgl>    <lgl>      <lgl> <lgl> #> 1 2015-05-31 12178 10689. 8233. 9461. calculati… TRUE     NA         TRUE  FALSE #> 2 2015-06-30 12888 10689. 8233. 9461. calculati… TRUE     FALSE      TRUE  FALSE #> 3 2015-07-31 12360 10689. 8233. 9461. calculati… TRUE     FALSE      TRUE  FALSE #> 4 2015-08-31 11232 10689. 8233. 9461. calculati… FALSE    FALSE      TRUE  FALSE #> 5 2015-09-30 11445 10689. 8233. 9461. calculati… FALSE    FALSE      TRUE  FALSE #> 6 2015-11-01  9330 10689. 8233. 9461. calculati… FALSE    FALSE      FALSE FALSE #> # ℹ 4 more variables: aboveOrBelowCl <int>, highlight <chr>, runStart <lgl>, #> #   log <chr>

what: Plot SPC charts with automated limit recalculation — plot_auto_SPC
title: Plot SPC charts with automated limit recalculation — plot_auto_SPC
text: plot_auto_SPC() creates statistical process control chart dataframe, applying Stable Shift Algorithm automate recalculation control limits.

title: Plot SPC charts with automated limit recalculation — plot_auto_SPC
code: plot_auto_SPC(   df,   x,   y,   n,   chartType = NULL,   periodMin = 21,   baseline = NULL,   runRuleLength = 8,   noRecals = FALSE,   recalEveryShift = FALSE,   noRegrets = TRUE,   overhangingReversions = TRUE,   maxNoOfExclusions = 3,   highlightExclusions = TRUE,   mr_screen_max_loops = 1L,   rule2Tolerance = 0,   floatingMedian = "no",   floatingMedian_n = 12L,   plotChart = TRUE,   showLimits = TRUE,   showMR = TRUE,   writeTable = FALSE,   verbosity = 0L,   log_file_path = NULL,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   use_caption = TRUE,   override_x_title = NULL,   override_y_title = NULL,   override_y_lim = NULL,   x_break = NULL,   x_date_format = "%Y-%m-%d",   x_pad_end = NULL,   extend_limits_to = NULL,   r1_col = "orange",   r2_col = "steelblue3",   point_size = 2,   line_width_sf = 1,   includeAnnotations = TRUE,   basicAnnotations = getRversion() < "4.3.0",   annotation_size = 3,   align_labels = FALSE,   flip_labels = FALSE,   upper_annotation_sf = NULL,   lower_annotation_sf = NULL,   annotation_arrows = FALSE,   annotation_arrow_curve = 0.3,   override_annotation_dist = NULL,   override_annotation_dist_P = NULL )

title: Plot SPC charts with automated limit recalculation — plot_auto_SPC
text: df data frame. XMR, C C' chart, must columns : subgrouping variable, plotted horizontal axis, (x); variable interest plotted vertical axis (y); optionally, title subtitle plot. P P' chart, must columns : subgrouping variable, plotted horizontal axis, (x); total count denominator (n); count meeting criteria, numerator (y); optionally, title subtitle plot. x Name column (passed using tidyselect semantics) use subgroups horizontal axis chart. y Name column (passed using tidyselect semantics) use : variable plotted XMR charts, count (plotted vertical axis) C C' charts, numerator proportion (plotted vertical axis) P P' charts. n Name column (passed using tidyselect semantics) use denominator P P' charts. chartType type chart wish plot. Available options : "XMR", "MR", "C", "C'", "P", "P'". periodMin minimum number points (subgroups) per period, .e. minimum number points required form control limits. baseline Integer, overrides periodMin first calculation period , specified runRuleLength minimum number consecutive points centre line constituting shift ("rule 2") break. noRecals Boolean - TRUE, recalculate control limits, instead extend limits calculated first periodMin points. recalEveryShift Boolean - whether bypass Stable Shift Algorithm simply re-establish limits every shift rule break (respecting periodMin) noRegrets Boolean signifying version algorithm used. Defines whether limits can change data added . overhangingReversions Boolean determining whether rule breaks opposite direction rule break triggering candidate recalculation prevent recalculation even overhang end candidate calculation period. Set FALSE noRegrets = FALSE. maxNoOfExclusions maximum number extreme points exclude limit calculations. highlightExclusions Boolean signifying whether excluded points greyed . mr_screen_max_loops Integer Inf specifying maximum number times recursively ignore mr values upper range limit calculating xmr limits. Note affect calculation upper range limit mr chart. rule2Tolerance Minimum difference point's vertical position centre line count "centre line" purposes shift rule breaks floatingMedian Whether add floating median line chart, calculated based final floatingMedian_n data points chart: "" - display floating median, "yes" - display floating median, "auto" - display floating median least one point part shift rule break final floatingMedian_n data points chart. floatingMedian_n number points use calculation floating median, present. plotChart Boolean specifying whether plot chart. , data returned centre line, control limits analytic output appended columns. showLimits Boolean controlling whether display centre line control limits showMR Logical controlling whether moving range chart included XMR chart writeTable Boolean specifying whether save data CSV (useful lots charts time). verbosity Integer 0-2 specifying talkative algorithm standard output log; higher number information provided, none 0. log_file_path NULL (default), path save log file . file extension provided (.rds .csv) determines type file log data saved . Full log data saved, regardless verbosity. title Optional string specifying chart title. Overrides df$title. subtitle Optional string specifying subtitle. Overrides df$subtitle. use_caption Boolean controlling whether caption displayed. override_x_title String specifying horizontal axis label. override_y_title String specifying vertical axis label. override_y_lim Optional numeric specifying upper limit vertical axis. x_break Optional numeric specifying spacing horizontal axis breaks. x_date_format Optional string format date labels horizontal axis. Passed scales::date_format. x_pad_end Optional, specifies minimum end point horizontal axis. extend_limits_to Optional, specifies point horizontal axis extend final limits r1_col Highlight colour breaks rule 1 (points outside control limits) r2_col Highlight colour breaks rule 2 (shifts) point_size Size plot points, defaults 2. See aes_linetype_size_shape details. line_width_sf Numeric scale factor plot line widths. includeAnnotations Boolean specifying whether show centre line labels basicAnnotations Boolean specifying whether force use basic annotation positioning. TRUE, suggested packages ggrepel ggpp required, annotation arrows supported. Defaults TRUE R versions prior 4.3, FALSE otherwise. annotation_size Text size centre line labels align_labels Boolean specifying whether align centre line labels fixed vertical position flip_labels Boolean specifying whether place centre line labels different sides centre line depending direction change previous period upper_annotation_sf Numeric scale factor specifying upper vertical position centre line labels multiple upper control limit lower_annotation_sf Numeric scale factor specifying lower vertical position centre line labels multiple lower control limit annotation_arrows Boolean specifying whether display arrows connecting centre line labels centre line refer annotation_arrow_curve Numeric curvature annotation arrows override_annotation_dist Deprecated override_annotation_dist_P Deprecated

title: Plot SPC charts with automated limit recalculation — plot_auto_SPC
code: # Using a C' chart to track changes in the count of monthly attendance  plot_auto_SPC(   ed_attendances_monthly,    chartType = "C'",    x = Month_Start,    y = Att_All )      #Using a P' chart to track changes in the percentage admitted within 4 hours plot_auto_SPC(   ed_attendances_monthly,    chartType = "P'",    x = Month_Start,    y = Within_4h,    n = Att_All )   #using a runRuleLength of 7 when tracking monthly attendance plot_auto_SPC(   ed_attendances_monthly,    chartType = "C'",    x = Month_Start,    y = Att_All,   runRuleLength = 7 )
